title: Trump Takes America’s ‘Imperial Presidency’ to a New Level
summary: In his first year back in the White House, President Trump has greatly expanded executive power while embracing the trappings of royalty in ways not seen in the modern era.

title: U.S. Coast Guard Boards Tanker Carrying Venezuelan Oil
summary: Kristi Noem, the homeland security secretary, said a vessel had been “apprehended.” It was the second action this month against a tanker carrying Venezuelan oil.

title: Immigration Crackdown Creates Fault Lines Among Baptists
summary: An increasingly loud contingent supports the Trump administration’s efforts to deport illegal immigrants.

title: Bill Clinton Photos in Epstein Files Show He Can’t Escape Scandal
summary: The Republican-led Justice Department’s release of photos of the former president with Jeffrey Epstein will introduce yet another generation to his flaws and controversies.

title: How the Supreme Court’s Mail-In Ballot Ruling Could Affect Voters
summary: Hundreds of thousands of Americans in rural and urban areas alike could see their votes rejected if the court decides that ballots must arrive by Election Day.

title: Turning Point’s Annual Gathering Turns Into a Gripefest
summary: At AmericaFest, conservative leaders insulted one another, revealing serious rifts over conspiracy theories, antisemitism and who belongs in America.

title: Mamdani Inauguration to Usher in ‘New Era’ With Broadway Block Party
summary: Zohran Mamdani will be sworn in as New York City’s new mayor on Jan. 1, alongside a party spanning seven blocks that will accommodate 40,000 spectators, his transition team said.

title: Move Aside, Snowflake: ‘Theater Kid’ Is the New Go-To Political Insult
summary: Zohran Mamdani, New York’s mayor-elect, is among the latest politicians to be tagged with the term, raising the question: What did theater kids do to deserve such scorn?

title: When Something Goes Wrong With Your Flight, These People Take Charge
summary: Inside a tornado-hardened office in Texas, 1,700 American Airlines employees manage the carrier’s operations, responding to bad weather, plane trouble and ailing passengers.

title: How Much More Can the U.S. Travel Industry Take?
summary: Politics and border hassles have chased away foreign visitors, costing businesses billions. Some fear next year’s World Cup won’t be enough to bring tourists back.

title: ‘It’s Just Us’: The Firefighter, His Son and a Treacherous Choice
summary: For two decades, Luis Martinez has fought wildfires for the U.S. government. Now he’s facing down cancer, debt and the threat of separation from his 11-year-old.

title: The Trump Vibe Shift Is Dead
summary: What will come in its wake?

title: 600 Readers Told Us About the Best Gifts They Ever Got. These Are the Top 13.
summary: We asked readers to tell us about the most memorable presents they’ve received.

title: Steakhouse Woes
summary: We examine how rising beef prices have stressed restaurant owners this holiday season.

title: Older Americans Quit Weight-Loss Drugs in Droves
summary: In some studies, half of patients stopped taking GLP-1s within a year despite the benefits, citing the expense and side effects.

title: Freed From a Belarus Prison, a Nobel Peace Laureate Experiences ‘Oxygen Intoxication’
summary: Ales Bialiatski, who shared the Nobel in 2022, described long hours of backbreaking work and stints in solitary confinement.

title: A ‘Timeout Box’ in an Elementary School Draws Outrage: ‘This is Not OK’
summary: An upstate New York district, where most students are Native American, placed its superintendent on leave after images of a wooden box in a classroom spread on social media.
